revised_title: Predicting Ionospheric Cross-Modulation in Radio Waves
tldr: This article presents a method for predicting the modulation imposed on a wanted radio wave by a powerful disturbing transmitter. The author categorizes situations into five model cases and examines each case in detail, deciding whether the simple theory of Huxley and Ratcliffe is applicable. The article also discusses improvements to the theory, considering the effect of the Earth's magnetic field, reflected waves, point transmitters, and transmitter power on the ionospheric cross-modulation.
